column1: Art Institute of Chicago////This is an incredible art museum! I spent three hours there last night and I feel like I barely scratched the surface. The interior design is amazing
column2: the museum is well organized (I would have been so lost without the map and help of the curators)
column3: and the collections are so expansive. Also
column4: the museum is so clean! The floors and walls are spotless. Particularly loved the Impressionism exhibit as well as seeing so many of Monet's works. I really appreciated that the museum has a free app with a ton of guided tours if you want some structure looking around. I started with the museum essentials tour to get the foundation and see the classics
column5: but I'd love to go back to look at some lesser-known works of art in more depth and detail.
